intro: Sebaea oreophila, commonly known as the mountain sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or shaded areas, preferring well-drained soils. Sebaea oreophila is often found in montane forests and is adapted to cooler, humid climates.
